posts.name: Alex Hart
posts.cooked:
We‚Äôre releasing the Signal 7.49 beta soon. If you‚Äôre interested in participating, join the beta group here.

Share your feedback on the latest changes:

‚òÖ TBD

Also lots of work in prep for the Signal Backups Alpha.

Complete list of new commits since 7.48.1:
https://github.com/signalapp/Signal-Android/compare/v7.48.1‚Ä¶main

Thank you for being a beta tester!

link_counts.title: Beta feedback for the upcoming Android 7.48 release

posts.cooked:
New Version: 7.49.0 (156200)

Builds will no longer be published to Firebase App Distribution

20 new commits since 7.48.1:

Show commits

  • Close all previous activities when launching into the main activitiy from restore backups. [1]

  • Fix benchmark test setup. [2]

  • Fix group update item bugs caused by backup support changes. [3]

  • Highlight all the message search matches. [4]

    It is expected that when a user search for a message, that all the
    matches within the same messages are highlighted (if there are more than
    one match) not just the first match. This is also consistent with how
    the search in the desktop app is implemented.
    Resolves #13960

  • Add additional debug info for the backups alpha. [5]

  • Migrate away from placeholder revision to support exporting pending approval groups. [6]

  • Add view settings button to backup settings screen. [7]

  • Update to ringrtc 2.54.0 [8]

  • Remove trailing space from backup key transform. [9]

  • Fix duplicate numbers, remove shortcodes entirely. [10]

  • Add support for call link epochs. [11]

  • Ensure story attachment data is deleted after expiration. [12]

  • Fix database consistency test. [13]

  • Show settings button in backup key save error dialog only when password manager settings are accessible. [14]

    To prevent crashes when the "go to settings" button is clicked in the backup key save to password manager error dialog, the "go to settings" button will only be displayed in cases where the intent resolves successfully.

  • Prompt to save PIN to device password manager. [15]

    Fixes an issue where the system auto-fill could overwrite the Signal backup key saved to the device password manager with the Signal PIN. The PIN confirmation screen now explicitly uses CredentialManager to save the Signal PIN under a separate username from the Signal Backups key, allowing both credentials to be stored and auto-filled correctly.

    • Add com.google.android.libraries.identity.googleid dependency so CredentialManager works on Android < 14.
    • Prompt to save Signal PIN to credential manager after PIN is created/edited.

  • Avoid crash when not connected to the network. [16]

  • Fix crash when attempting to clear pending GlideImage loads. [17]

    Hold a reference to the Glide RequestManager instead of creating a new instance when attempting to clear pending loads and free resources for the target.

  • Print active session count while attempting APK Upgrade. [18]

  • Update translations and other static files. [19]

  • Bump version to 7.49.0 [20]

Gathered from signalapp/Signal-Android v7.48.1‚Ä¶v7.49.0

Localization changes

posts.name: Alex Hart
posts.cooked: kicked off just now.

posts.name: Hugo
posts.cooked:
Hey, quick question. I‚Äôm not sure if this is a valid bug report or more of a quirk from Signal (in iOS? Should I report this on the iOS thread?):

What's your most-missed-feature-ranking?

When sharing voice messages from WhatsApp to Signal, they are imported as .opus and this doesn‚Äôt work on iPhones. Edge case, I know, but it‚Äôs happened to me a couple of times so I end up using WhatsApp again and it defeats the purpose.

I added it as a comment in the feature request thread, but I gave it some thought and maybe this is a bug?

It happens when you receive a WhatsApp voice message, you use the Share option, select Signal, and send it to any conversation where the recipient is an iPhone user. Signal converts it to .opus, but they can‚Äôt play those.

This is not specific to 7.49.x, last time it happened to me was in April (so, not a common occurrence), message ID 1744228827695, but I played the WA shared voice message (on my Android device) before generating this debug log: https://debuglogs.org/android/7.49.0/00931d09c25a958e7297fd6171367a06647c8d2dcac3db5175874f7ce5a09d91

posts.name: Alex Hart
posts.cooked: We don‚Äôt convert audio files in Signal, so if you share one into Signal it‚Äôll just send as is, to the best of my knowledge. OPUS looks like a lossy audio codec that on ios we would need to explicitply support.
Please add Android Beta Feedback subcategory!

posts.name: Xashyar
posts.cooked:
Not exactly related to this beta thread, but Signal-Desktop fails to render .mov video files received from mobile (which render fine on Android):

image686√ó228 3.53 KB

In other words shouldn‚Äôt Android check for cross-platform compatibility before sending media?

In a group there was notification that 4 members has the same name. When I opened it, there were just 2 members with the same name.

signal-2025-07-18-2129561024√ó395 39.7 KB

signal-2025-07-18-2130351024√ó1081 53.5 KB

I opened group chat from notification. When I got back to Signal main screen my chat list was completely empty. No chats, no folders, nothing. Everything appeared again after I opened and closed settings.

posts.name: Hugo
posts.cooked:
The bouncing/autoscrolling chat list bug just happened to me again

Beta feedback for the upcoming Android 7.42 release

My theory is that it‚Äôs not Signal related, but some bug in Android 14+

I‚Äôve seen it happen a couple of times in WhatsApp

Previous thread with the links to the rest of the rabbit hole: Beta feedback for the upcoming Android 7.42 release - #39 by hmzuleta

https://debuglogs.org/android/7.49.1/cac0ad7911deb0fe8c468ee4d2dbae3a0aca2957774d14179070a362d5f16db2

Message ID: 1753223281921

The message had an image attachment, and I was at the bottom of the chat list (up to date, no unread messages).
